briefdescription.para: Tell the scheduler how_many_items of input stream which_input were consumed.
Tell the scheduler how_many_items were consumed on each input stream.
Tell the scheduler how_many_items were produced on output stream which_output.
Tell the scheduler how_many_items were produced on each output stream.
Adds a new tag to the given output stream.

detaileddescription.para: Calls gr_buffer::add_item_tag(), which appends the tag onto its deque.

parameterdescription.para: an integer of which output stream to attach the tag

briefdescription.para: Removes a tag from the given input stream.

detaileddescription.para: Calls gr_buffer::remove_item_tag(), which removes the tag from its deque.

parameterdescription.para: an integer of which input stream to remove the tag from

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< gr_tag_t > &v, unsigned int which_input, uint64_t abs_start, uint64_t abs_end)
memberdef.name: get_tags_in_range

briefdescription.para: Given a [start,end), returns a vector of all tags in the range.

detaileddescription.para: Pass-through function to gr_buffer_reader to get a vector of tags in given range. Range of counts is from start to end-1.
Tags are tuples of: (item count, source id, key, value)

parameterdescription.para: a vector reference to return tags into
an integer of which input stream to pull from
a uint64 count of the start of the range of interest
a uint64 count of the end of the range of interest

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< gr_tag_t > &v, unsigned int which_input, uint64_t abs_start, uint64_t abs_end, const pmt::pmt_t &key)
memberdef.name: get_tags_in_range

briefdescription.para: Given a [start,end), returns a vector of all tags in the range with a given key.

detaileddescription.para: Calls get_tags_in_range(which_input, abs_start, abs_end) to get a vector of tags from the buffers. This function then provides a secondary filter to the tags to extract only tags with the given 'key'.
Tags are tuples of: (item count, source id, key, value)

parameterdescription.para: a vector reference to return tags into
an integer of which input stream to pull from
a uint64 count of the start of the range of interest
a uint64 count of the end of the range of interest
a PMT symbol to select only tags of this key

briefdescription.para: Set core affinity of block to the cores in the vector mask.

parameterdescription.para: a vector of ints of the core numbers available to this block.

briefdescription.para: Implementation details to support the signal processing abstraction

This class contains implementation detail that should be "out of sight" of almost all users of GNU Radio. This decoupling also means that we can make changes to the guts without having to recompile everything.
